ghost

Class Waka

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.GameObject
      • ghost.Movable
        • ghost.Waka

  • public class Waka
extends Movable
    The main player of the game. Attempts to eat all the fruit without colliding with ghosts. Moves at the same speed as ghosts. Has a number of lives set by the config file. If all the lives are lost, the game is over.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class ghost.Movable

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Logic performed in each frame: Selects a direction based on the player input and waka position and direction. Moves in said direction. Update collision borders, then check if there is a ghost collision. If the player has been killed by a ghost, call the resetIfDead() method which resets the player and ghosts back to starting position.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • resetIfDead

        public void resetIfDead()
        Reset waka and ghost locations if dead, and remove a life

      • determineSpriteOpen

        public boolean determineSpriteOpen()
        Use frame cycle to determine if the sprite should be open or closed, and set the sprite as open if it should be open
        Returns:
        True if sprite should be open, closed if sprite should be closed

      • setSpriteOpen

        public void setSpriteOpen()
        Changes the open sprite to face different directions depending on waka's direction of travel

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw either the closed or open sprite depending on whether this.determineSpriteOpen returns true or not. Also draws the lives waka has depending on his lives remaining.
        Specified by:
        draw in class GameObject

      • checkWallCollision

        public void checkWallCollision()
        Check if the player is colliding into a wall. Used when the player has not provided valid input at a junction.
